sentences.english: He was not free enough, was how he preferred to phrase it.
sentences.chinese: 他没有多少空闲时间，是他喜欢说的一句口头禅。

sentences.english: What do you usually do when you have some spare time?
sentences.chinese: 那你空闲时间喜欢干些什么呢？

sentences.english: If you have free time then you can try new hobbies.
sentences.chinese: 如果你有空闲的时间，那么你可以试试新的爱好。

sentences.english: Slack Utilization has been proven efficient in dynamic voltage scaling (DVS).
sentences.chinese: 空闲时间利用是动态电压升降的有效途径。

sentences.english: What discussed that the university life is much idle?
sentences.chinese: 何谈大学生活多空闲呢？

sentences.english: When 6. free times the assistance warehouse tube processes the warehouse thing.
sentences.chinese: 空闲时协助仓管员处理仓库事物。

sentences.english: But am I going to devote all my spare time to it?
sentences.chinese: 但我会把全部的空闲时间都消磨在拼字上吗？

sentences.english: I can use all kinds of translative tools (Trados). I am a professional, so I have enough time to work.
sentences.chinese: 我是一名自由职业者，日常工作日均有充足空闲时间。

sentences.english: I have very few days available at the moment.
sentences.chinese: 我目前没几天是空闲的。

sentences.english: In your spare time, you can play basketball, pingpong and so on.
sentences.chinese: 在你的空闲时间，你可以打篮球，乒乓球等等。

sentences.english: What do you usually do in your free time?
sentences.chinese: 你空闲的时候经常做些什么呢？

sentences.english: She gets a free afternoon once a week.
sentences.chinese: 每周她有一个空闲覃辉下午。

sentences.english: This paper presents a case study on surplus thermal power being exchange between power grids and associate prices.
sentences.chinese: 本文介绍一网间空闲火电容量交换的案例研究。

sentences.english: Lessing believes that she was freer than most people because she became a writer.
sentences.chinese: 莱辛认为自己比大多数人空闲，因为她成了一名作家。

sentences.english: You are free. I think you should invest your time in something.
sentences.chinese: 你有很多空闲时间，我认为你该投入些时间做点事。

sentences.english: Not bad for something you can practice in your free time.
sentences.chinese: 空闲时间练练这个倒也不坏。

definition: to have nothing to do/to have time on one's hands
to find the time to do sth
at leisure/idle/to have nothing to do
to (try to) find the time to
to have nothing to do/to idle one's time away (idiom)
